posts.post_content: Why is this rated so low? It will hold up pretty well for non-destruction based removal ([Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt)) and gets nice mana. Turn 6 you're looking at 8 mana (+2 yessss), turn 7, 10, turn 8, 12. Non-mono black it's pretty bad, but in mono black, it can really ramp the mana.

Posted By: armogohma (10/21/2012 12:40:37 AM)

posts.post_content:
The thing is, this doesn't waste you a land drop, like [Cabal Coffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cabal Coffers) does.   
  
I've noticed that, if you want your money's worth on [Cabal Coffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cabal Coffers), you need 4 swamps out: that's 5 land drops (because if you calculate it, Coffers could've counted as a swamp, so if you had 3 swamps, you use 2 to tap it, and then you get ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol): equal to 3 swamps)  
  
By time you get 5 lands out, you could play this.   
  
No, this isn't better than [Cabal Coffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cabal Coffers). It's counterable, it requires a turn to wait before you get mana, and it can be killed more frequently with removal. However, after playing 2-coloured and aggro decks with [Cabal Coffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cabal Coffers) in it, I can say that it isn't as good as I initially believed.
posts.html:
The thing is, this doesn't waste you a land drop, like Cabal Coffers does.

I've noticed that, if you want your money's worth on Cabal Coffers, you need 4 swamps out: that's 5 land drops (because if you calculate it, Coffers could've counted as a swamp, so if you had 3 swamps, you use 2 to tap it, and then you get : equal to 3 swamps)

By time you get 5 lands out, you could play this.

No, this isn't better than Cabal Coffers. It's counterable, it requires a turn to wait before you get mana, and it can be killed more frequently with removal. However, after playing 2-coloured and aggro decks with Cabal Coffers in it, I can say that it isn't as good as I initially believed.
